com.vernalis.knime.mmp

Class RDKitFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.vernalis.knime.mmp.RDKitFragment

  • public class RDKitFragment
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides some static convenience methods for the fragmenting of molecules and the conversion of fragmented molecules to MMP transforms. The preferred entry point is doRDKitFragmentation(ROMol, String, int, String, boolean, ExecutionContext)
    Author:
    "Stephen Roughley "

    • Method Detail

      • doRDKitFragmentation

        public static java.util.HashMap<FragmentKey,java.util.TreeSet<FragmentValue>> doRDKitFragmentation(org.RDKit.ROMol roMol,
                                                                                   java.lang.String ID,
                                                                                   int numFragmentations,
                                                                                   java.lang.String fragSMIRKS,
                                                                                   boolean trackCutConnectivity,
                                                                                   org.knime.core.node.ExecutionContext exec)
                                                                                            throws org.knime.core.node.CanceledExecutionException
        Convenience method to apply the fragmentation to an ROMol input object. This is the most likely entrance point.
        Parameters:
        roMol - The molecule to fragment
        ID - The molecule ID
        numFragmentations - The number of rounds of fragmentations to apply (i.e. the number of bonds to break)
        fragSMIRKS - The RDKit reaction SMARTS (SMIRKS) to use to break the bonds. Attachment points in the 'products' should be included as '[*]' in order to allow corrected labelling
        trackCutConnectivity - If true, then the attachment points are labelled to preserve regiochemistry
        Returns:
        HashMap of FragmentKeys linking to TreeSet of FragmentValues
        Throws:
        org.knime.core.node.CanceledExecutionException

      • doRDKitFragmentation

        public static java.util.HashMap<FragmentKey,java.util.TreeSet<FragmentValue>> doRDKitFragmentation(java.util.HashMap<FragmentKey,java.util.TreeSet<FragmentValue>> fragments,
                                                                                   int numFragmentations,
                                                                                   java.lang.String fragSMIRKS,
                                                                                   boolean trackCutConnectivity,
                                                                                   org.knime.core.node.ExecutionContext exec)
                                                                                            throws org.knime.core.node.CanceledExecutionException
        This method performs multiple layers of fragmentation by recursion using the RDKit toolkit
        Parameters:
        fragments - Fragments from previous fragmentation layer. #doRDKitFragmentation(ROMol, String, int, String, boolean) is a convenience method to convert an initial input molecule to this format correctly.
        numFragmentations - The number of rounds of fragmentations to apply (i.e. the number of bonds to break)
        fragSMIRKS - The RDKit reaction SMARTS (SMIRKS) to use to break the bonds. Attachment points in the 'products' should be included as '[*]' in order to allow corrected labelling
        trackCutConnectivity - If true, then the attachment points are labelled to preserve regiochemistry
        exec -
        Returns:
        HashMap of FragmentKeys linking to TreeSet of FragmentValues
        Throws:
        org.knime.core.node.CanceledExecutionException

      • getTransforms

        public static java.util.ArrayList<org.knime.core.data.DataCell[]> getTransforms(java.util.TreeSet<FragmentValue> fragmentValues,
                                                                int numNewCols,
                                                                boolean removeExplicitHs,
                                                                boolean includeNumChangingHAs,
                                                                boolean showReverseTransforms)
        Get the transfroms for a TreeSet of FragmentValues, optionally including the number of changing heavy atoms. This is the simple method not requiring access to the FragmentKey
        Parameters:
        fragmentValues - A TreeSet of FragmentValues from which to derive transforms
        numNewCols - The number of new columns - supplied so only calculated once during the NodeModel #configure method.
        removeExplicitHs - If true, then explicit hydrogens are removed from the outputs
        includeNumChangingHAs - If true, then the number of changing heavy atoms are added for each fragment
        showReverseTransforms - If true, then the output includes transformations in both directions
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of DataCells for each new transform to be added derived from the TreeSet of FragmentValues

      • getTransforms

        public static java.util.ArrayList<org.knime.core.data.DataCell[]> getTransforms(java.util.TreeSet<FragmentValue> fragmentValues,
                                                                FragmentKey fragmentKey,
                                                                int numNewCols,
                                                                boolean removeExplicitHs,
                                                                boolean includeKeySMILES,
                                                                boolean includeNumChangingHAs,
                                                                boolean includeRatioHAs,
                                                                boolean showReverseTransforms)
        Overloaded method to get the transforms for a TreeSet of FragmentValues, optionally including the number of changing heavy atoms, and properties relating to the FragmentKey.
        Parameters:
        fragmentValues - A TreeSet of FragmentValues from which to derive transforms
        fragmentKey - The FragmentKey from which to derive the unchanging atoms and HA ratios
        numNewCols - The number of new columns - supplied so only calculated once during the NodeModel #configure method.
        removeExplicitHs - If true, then explicit hydrogens are removed from the outputs
        includeKeySMILES - If true, then the SMILES representation of the unchanging atoms is included in the output
        includeNumChangingHAs - If true, then the number of changing heavy atoms are added for each fragment
        includeRatioHAs - If true, then the rations of changing / unchanging heavy atoms are added for each transformation
        showReverseTransforms - If true, then the output includes transformations in both directions
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of DataCells for each new transform to be added derived from the TreeSet of FragmentValues

      • filterFragments

        public static java.util.HashMap<FragmentKey,java.util.TreeSet<FragmentValue>> filterFragments(java.util.HashMap<FragmentKey,java.util.TreeSet<FragmentValue>> fragments,
                                                                              java.lang.Integer maxNumVarAtoms,
                                                                              java.lang.Double minCnstToVarAtmRatio)
        Utility function to filter fragments by number and ratio of heavy atoms
        Parameters:
        fragments - The fragments to filter
        maxNumVarAtoms - The maximum number of varying heavy atoms (null if filter not to be applied)
        minCnstToVarAtmRatio - The minimum ration of varying to constant heavy atoms (null if filter not to be applied)
        Returns:
        The filtered list of fragments

public static java.util.HashMap<FragmentKey,java.util.TreeSet<FragmentValue>> runRDKitFragmentFromRxn(org.RDKit.ROMol roMol,

                                                                                                 org.RDKit.ChemicalReaction rxn,
                                                                                                 java.lang.Integer cutIndex)
        Deprecated. Use runRDKitFragment(ROMol, String, String, Integer, boolean, ExecutionContext)
        This method actually runs a fragmentation - public use is discouraged!
